message: To maximize my chances of winning, I should try to coordinate with one other player to avoid collision on the first turn. I'll suggest that we all move different numbers to avoid collision. Let's try to stagger our moves. I propose P1 moves 1, P2 moves 3, and I (P3) move 5, or some similar permutation. This way, one of us is guaranteed to advance. I'll wait for your responses to see if we can agree on a strategy.

I agree with P3’s proposal to stagger moves to avoid collision. Let’s assign numbers to ensure one of us advances. I’ll take <move>1</move> this turn. P2, you take <move>3</move>, and P3, you take <move>5</move>. This way, we all have a fair chance to progress. If we stick to this plan, we can rotate numbers in future turns to keep advancing. Let’s confirm this quickly so we can move on.

However, I propose we rotate who gets the highest number in future turns to ensure fairness. P3 gets 5 this round, P1 gets 5 next round, and I get 5 the following round. This way, we all have equal chances to advance further. Does this rotation plan work for everyone?
